Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BABS7020 - Biotechnology Commercialisation Strategy in Australia and Asia","description":"

Through case studies, this course explores how scientific discovery is developed into intellectual property and how product and service opportunities based on this IP are identified and evaluated for commercial potential.  Using real IP for platform technologies, students will identify, define, strategize and prioritise pipelines for commercialisation in the major markets of the US and Europe.  The analysis will include a commercialisation strategy address Australasian and Asian markets.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"88ff89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961961","name":"Fully online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Open Book Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

Two online, ‘open book’, timed quizzes to assess the learning of basic concepts in the commercialisation process and intellectual property identification, valuation and translation

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7fef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"bbef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"17ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96192c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Class Discussion","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"20","description":"

Participation in two asynchronous class discussions to discuss, analyse and evaluate two case studies, which will be assessed on the quality and consistency of contributions

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7fef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"bbef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f7ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961955","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6fef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961930","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case study report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

This assessment task aims to develop the ability to evaluate the value of IP for a biotechnology opportunity and its market potential. Students are required to analyse the IP strategy employed by two global biotechnology-based companies. Students will conduct a SWOT analysis to evaluate, compare and contrast these strategies in terms of IP breadth, expense and value to the company.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7fef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"bbef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f7ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961955","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a7ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961935","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Commercialisation Strategy Plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"40","description":"

Teams (4 members) will prepare a Commercialisation strategy plan that identifies, assesses and develops an opportunity for a real local biotech start-up in the Australian and/or Asian biotechnology market. This plan will address the whole process of commercialisation, including IP strategy, funding, regulation and partnering. For assessment, students will submit the plan as a team effort. They will also be expected to participate in asynchronous team discussions on the project, writing the plan and using feedback from another team to improve their final submission. As a team, they will also be required to review the plan from another team and provide them with critical feedback.

(Breakdown of assessment: comprising of a team written plan – 25%, Individual contributions to their own team - 10%, and a team peer review of another group’s written plan – 5%)

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"37ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961958","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"73ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96195b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7fef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96194f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"bbef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"bfef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96195d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f7ef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961955","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"efef89bbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961939","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BABS7020.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"","links":[]}

This course focuses on the biotechnology financial life cycle. Effective management of money is key to the success of any enterprise, and even more so in the biotechnology sector due to the long lead times before sustainable and profitable revenue is achieved. Students will become aware of the internal and external challenges business leaders must address to reach each key milestone of a company's development and how these successes must be leveraged to create the value necessary to foster and maintain investor confidence  The funding cycle and the processes involved in securing government support (grants, tax incentives, and other commercialisation incentives and resources), private investment (business angel, venture capital, private equity), industry partnerships, stock exchange listing (IPO) through to mergers and acquisitions will be introduced. Students will learn how to interpret and prepare financial statements and to negotiate term sheets and contractual agreements. Through completing the course, students will learn the language of business and finance and gain insight into how biotechnology success is determined by effective risk and financial management. This insight will be reinforced through case studies and assignments that involve the business analysis of successful and failed companies.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"efff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961910","name":"Fully online - "},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Class Discussion","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"25","description":"

Participation in five asynchronous class discussions to analyse, interpret and reflect on examples of specific company case studies. Participation will be assessed on the quality and consistency of contributions

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"17ff0dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619ff","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"1bff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"53ff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961902","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"67ff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"9fff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"dbff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"0bff0dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619ae","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

Each student will financially analyse two public biotechnology companies (one listed in Australia and the other in the US).  They will attempt to reconcile the companies’ share price trends in the context of internal (e.g. IP, regulatory, investment, partnerships, management) and external factors (e.g. global economics, politics, legislation, regulatory). Students will report on how the companies’ share price performance has impacted on their capacity to raise capital and maintain investor confidence. The report will also reflect on internal and external differences between companies listed on Australian (ASX) and US (NASDAQ, New York) exchanges.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"1bff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"67ff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"dbff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4fff0dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619e4","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 1","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"30","description":"

A team (4 students) will analyse a biotechnology company’s financial statements and its technology in order to evaluate the company’s future potential. This due diligence process will investigate all key areas essential to biotechnology company commercial success. These include finance, technology and product development, competitive advantage and market opportunity, IP management, targeted or potential exit strategies, and risk management.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"1bff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"67ff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96190d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"dbff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"87ff0dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619e9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"15","description":"

Three online, ‘open book’, timed quizzes to assess the learning of basic concepts and ability to interpret and evaluate aspects of company financial statements and industry-specific financial and business information

This course focuses on the practicalities and cultural norms of doing biotechnology business in all major Asian markets including India, China, Japan, and South Korea. The political, economic, legal, bureaucratic, IP, regulation and administration, and reimbursement environment of each country will be explored.  Cultural and social issues involved in negotiation and doing business will be explored through case studies and the preparation of business strategy for a real opportunity for entering Asian markets.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"10005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961967","name":"Fully online - "},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Reflection","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"10","description":"

Students will be required to reflect on how the debate in Task 3 might be led differently in different regions of Asia and relate this to variations in leadership and management roles in Asia. They will also be required to reflect on their learning and how it will inform their personal and professional development.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"48005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961960","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"84005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961963","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3bff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961951","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional business brochure","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"40","description":"

This assessment task has 2 parts: part 1 is a brochure and part 2 is a class discussion on the brochure. In part 1, students will be required to select one major Asian market, analyse its socio-economic, cultural, political, legal and ethical context and discuss the impacts this context may have on the entry and operation of biotechnology companies in this market. Students will then focus on opportunities and challenges facing a real company entering the market and propose senior management level strategies to maximise the company’s potential for success. Students will be required to present all the required information in a two page (A4) professional business brochure. The brochure accounts for 30%

In part 2, all the posters will be uploaded on a Wiki page and students will participate in a class discussion on the variety and complexity of the strategies for the entry or operation of biotechnology companies in these Asian markets and draw implications for those who wish to expand their business across the Australasian region. Students will be assessed based on their contributions to the class discussion, which accounts for 10%

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"0c005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96195d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"cc005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96195a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b7ff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961948","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Professional debate","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

This assessment task has 2 parts: part 1 is a small team professional debate and part 2 is a class discussion. In part 1, teams of 4 students will engage in an internal team debate of the top 3 priorities (barriers or opportunities) for a biotechnology company expanding operations into a particular Asian country. They will be required to compare and contrast the unique issues facing a biotechnology company operating in multiple regions of Asia and global markets, with specific reference to the political, economic, legal, bureaucratic, IP, regulation and administration, and reimbursement environments.  The debate on these priorities will be reported and justified in a written report, which is submitted for assessment and accounts for 30%.

In part 2, all team reports will be uploaded  on a Wiki page. The class will discuss the significance of the top priorities and strategies to address them. Individual students will prepare a written brief on management considerations and recommendations to the executive committee of a company considering expansion into the Asian market. The brief will then be submitted for assessment and accounts for 20%

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"48005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961960","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"84005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961963","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"cc005dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96195a","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ffff4dbbdbb91c50eb6b147a3a96194c","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BABS7040.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"","links":[]}

The political, economic, legal, bureaucratic, IP, regulation and administration, and reimbursement environment of each country will be explored.  Cultural and social issues involved in negotiation and doing business will be explored through case studies and the preparation of business strategy for a real opportunity for entering Asian markets.

This course gives students an introduction to the core skills required to undertake a research project in the Biotechnology discipline. Students participate in tutorial and laboratory sessions to learn key skills such as equipment handling, analytical techniques in biotechnology and data handling. In addition, students develop their skills in the research of the scientific literature. This course is designed as a prelude to the subject BABS7190 - Biotechnology Research Project 2.

contentlets.description: Research in the School of BABS covers the span of fundamental through to applied research in areas such as bacteriology, virology, genetics, cell biology, genomics, proteomics, immunology, environmental microbiology and bioprocessing. This course aims to expose students in the Masters of Philosophy program to this diversity through attendance at the School postgraduate and invited speaker seminar programs. Students will prepare an indexed list of abstracts based on attendance and in addition, prepare a mini-review paper on at least one of the topics covered in the research seminar program.
contentlets.title: Advanced Topics in Biotechnology and Biomolecular
